home.concept-text1: Cocorico, a bridge between French language acquisition and drama art !
home.concept-text2: We offer your students the chance to participate a workshop, as part of your School Vacation Program or Week Without Walls, to improve their French language level, while having fun through drama and creative expression activities.
home.concept-text3: Cocorico is designed to support students’ learning of French language and culture, as well as developing an understanding of global challenges and a commitment to act as responsible citizens through engaging and relevant activities. It encourages the growth of creative, reflective and most importantly communication skills through practical work in a caring-relaxed and student-oriented atmosphere.
home.concept-text4: It nurtures young learners, and helps them go through a creative process development, all leading up to a performance in front of their parents and invited guests.
home.spotlight-text-p1: The workshop « Passion of France- Spotlight on the Environment » aims to facilitate understanding of France, its cultural and geographical richness and the global challenges it faces.
home.spotlight-text-p2: Through an investigation of ecological and social data, students will reflect on certain local and specific topics such as: climate change, pollution problems, protecting the oceans, biodiversity, etc. according to UN sustainable development goals to transform our World. After, they will broaden their horizons.
home.learning-text1: Gaining proficiency in comprehending and producing oral/written texts in French language
home.learning-text2: Using French language as a vehicle of thought, reflection, self-expression and learning throughout other subjects
home.learning-text3: Promoting curiosity and factual/conceptual knowledge about Francophony world
home.pedagogical-text-p1: COCORICO encourages the use of artistic activities base on drama to increase learners’ confidence, motivate them and improve their memory of the language they are learning.
home.pedagogical-text-p2: Drama and artistic activities put language into context. When dialogues, grammatical structures, song lyrics, musical phrasing and vocabulary are contextualised they become meaningful and memorable.
home.pedagogical-list1-p1: They help integrate content with language.
home.pedagogical-list1-p2: They are multi-sensory. Learners can act, dance, sing, chant, move, speak, listen, read, write and draw which helps them remember what they are learning.
home.pedagogical-list1-p3: They encourage co-operation, interaction and communication.
home.pedagogical-list1-p4: They encourage adventurous thought so learners are inspired to become brave and creative in their language and expression.
home.pedagogical-list1-p5: They are holistic. They involve language, knowledge, thought, emotions, expression, imagination, intuition, memory, action and leadership. A holistic approach helps learners understand and communicate the meaning of the language they are learning.
home.pedagogical-list1-p6: They give learners a sense of contentment, achievement and success — these positive experiences stimulate language learning.
home.pedagogical-tools-p2: Learning Portfolio for students on MOODLE composed of different rubrics and tools to support the students' achievement in French language, such as vocabulary, grammar in context or phonetics, as well as encourage their curiosity for French culture, drama and the workshop theme.

typical.subtitle: TYPICAL SCHEDULE
typical.description: Here is a proposal for a 5 days workshop.
typical.description-add: Other workshops formats that meet your expectations can be offered.
typical.day-1-description-p1: Activities for community building, understanding the theme, brainstorming.
typical.day-2-description-p1: Activities for scriptwriting and turning stories into scenery and scripts.
typical.day-3-description-p1: Activities for storyboarding, collaborative writing. Exploratory drama, and drama techniques.
typical.day-4-description-p1: Mini-creative workshops focused on student’s needs and interests: grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, direction, promotion, performance evaluation criteria and improvements, costumes and props.

about.valerie-about1: I’m Valérie, I was born in France and I have been living across the world. I am passionate about traveling, reading, cooking and discovering new things.
about.valerie-about2: Having graduated with honors, and with a Master in Cultural Management and a Master in French as a foreign language, my working journey has been thrilling, fruitful and inspiring. Juggling my passion for performing and visuals arts, and teaching for more than 15 years, I have offered my services in various institutions such as festivals, museums and international schools in France and abroad.
about.valerie-about3: I have always been enthusiastic about igniting children's curiosity and joy of learning French language through drama and creative expression activities.
about.valerie-about-link: Have a look at my curriculum vitae!

humans-of.subtitle: HUMANS OF COCORICO
humans-of.pawel: Pawel: Valérie’s Husband, sound and light technician: he runs and controls the sound/light equipment as well as the special effects decided by myself and the students for the show direction. He is also in charge of the website.

about.sponsors-text: COCORICO is pleased to collaborate with sponsors to fulfill our common goals, to promote France culture and the community blooming. Our audience comes from all over the world, as most of them are expatriates and are eager to better know French gastronomy as well as French delicacies. As a sponsor of the final performance, your company will be linked with one of local vibrant educational resources, benefit a great platform for social media content and receive valuable marketing benefits.

faq.answer1-p1: “ Cocorico ” is the crowing rooster sound according to French people. Since the Revolution, the « Coq Gaulois » (the Gallic Rooster) has been one of the unofficial emblems of France.
faq.answer1-p2: “ Cocorico ” a play on words of the Latin “gallus” meaning Gaul, and gallus meaning « coq », or rooster.
faq.answer1-p3: What's fun is that it changes completely depending of your mother tongue. If you speak Romanian, it will turn into « cucurigu », in Tagalog, « kukaok », or « gaggalagó » in Icelandic.
faq.question2: How to organize and book one workshop in my school ?
faq.answer2: Do not hesitate to contact Valerie, to share your vision, purposes and needs. The school and Valérie will then plan how to best meet your needs. The tours are organized according to the school bookings and the common agreements.
faq.question3: What about the school handbook and code of conduct ?
faq.answer3-p1: During the workshop, both students and Valerie will follow all instructions given by the school regarding :
faq.answer3-p3: the dress code : for practical reasons, I would recommend dark or neutral colors and comfortable shoes and attire. The costumes for the performances are loaned by the families
faq.answer3-p5: rules and regulations regarding electronic devices as well as the daily activities schedule
faq.answer3-p6: the procedures for emergencies, illness, or discipline problems
faq.answer3-p7: the procedures for student arrival, dismissal, late arrival, leave at the end of the day
faq.answer3-p8: the procedures for a fire drill, storm, tornado, code red and silent fan out
faq.question4: Is the workshop appropriate for children with physical disabilities or developmental disorders ?
faq.answer4: Cocorico offers a creative, supportive and inclusive learning environment so students with a disability can learn with their peers. Valerie has been trained to teach students with specific needs, such as students with dyslexia, autistic spectrum disorder (ASD) or behaviour emotional social difficulties (BESD).
faq.answer5-p1: The performance is a show performed by all of the workshop participants held on the fifth day of the workshop, on Friday evening. It is a chance for them to present their new knowledge and improvements in front of their parents, as well as a list of guests whose number depends on the room and the school direction. A few performance tickets will be offered to them.
faq.answer5-p2: The show is given in French but different strategies of the staging will help the audience to understand what is happening during the performance.
faq.answer5-p3: The audience is invited to participate by expressing themselves in their mother tongue, in English or in French, about some cultural and historical facts, which contribute to the pleasant and joyful atmosphere.
faq.answer5-p4: At the end of the performance, the whole audience and the performers are invited to share an « Apero », a traditional and convivial French aperitif offered by our sponsor. A refreshing and flavored moment to end this French week full of discovery and inspiration.
